Class PlayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class PlayList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayList(java.lang.String[] fileNames)
      Create a new play list from an array of Strings naming MP3 files.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayList

        public PlayList(java.lang.String[] fileNames)
        Create a new play list from an array of Strings naming MP3 files. The list itself contains AudioSource objects created from the filenames.
        Parameters:
        fileNames - The array of audio filenames for this play list.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the size of the play list (the number of AudioSources in it).
        Returns:
        size of the playlist

      • play

        public void play(int index)
        Play a specific AudioSource in the list. When done playing, the try to move on to the next AudioSource in the play list.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the entry to play.

      • getSourceIndex

        public int getSourceIndex()
        Index of the AudioSource being played.
        Returns:
        Index of the current source or (-1) if the player is idle.

      • getSource

        public AudioSource getSource(int i)
        Return the i'th AudioSource.
        Parameters:
        i - index of the AudioSource to retrieve
        Returns:
        ith AudioSource if it exists, else null.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Return the position in AudioSource being played.
        Returns:
        millisecond position in current stream or 0 if no stream is being played

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause playback. Only has effect if the AudioPlayer is playing.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume playback. Only has an effect if the AudioPlayer is paused.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
          java.lang.Object junk)
        Update called when an audio stream finishes playing. This is only called when the stream being played completes without interruption; the assumption is that the client will decide to stop or will select a new file to play.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - The observable object sending the update
        junk - Ignored secondary information.
